conversation:
Detective Sam Carter entered the dimly lit room. "What a mess!", he muttered, surveying the scattered papers and overturned furniture. The victim, a local journalist, lay sprawled on the floor, a pen still clutched in his hand.
(User: Sam knelt beside the body, examining the scene. "Looks like he was onto something big. But what?" He noticed a torn piece of paper sticking out from under the desk.)
new_declarations:
sam_carter: Sam Carter, a character
room: room, a location
papers: papers, an item
furniture: furniture, an item
victim: victim, a character
journalist: journalist, a character
floor: floor, a location
pen: pen, an item
hand: hand, a part of the body
body: body, a part of the body
desk: desk, an item
piece_of_paper: piece of paper, an item
scene: scene, an event

enter(a, b, t): character [a] enters location [b] for time [t]
is_lit(a, b, t): object [a] is lit in [b] for time [t]
is_a_mess(a, t): object [a] is a mess for time [t]
is_scattered(a, t): object [a] is scattered for time [t]
is_overturned(a, t): object [a] is overturned for time [t]
is_victim_of(a, b, t): character [a] is the victim of [b] for time [t]
lie_on(a, b, t): object [a] lies on object [b] for time [t]
hold(a, b, t): character [a] holds object [b] for time [t]
is_clutched_in(a, b, t): object [a] is clutched in object [b] for time [t]
kneel_beside(a, b, t): character [a] kneels beside object [b] for time [t]
examine(a, b, t): character [a] examines object [b] for time [t]
is_onto(a, b, t): character [a] is onto something [b] for time [t]
stick_out_from_under(a, b, t): object [a] sticks out from under object [b] for time [t]
pseudo_predefinitions:
forall(a t). enter(a, room, t) -> not(enter(a, floor, t))
forall(a b t). lie_on(a, b, t) -> not(is_scattered(a, t))
forall(a b t). hold(a, b, t) -> not(is_scattered(b, t))
forall(a b t). hold(a, b, t) -> not(lie_on(b, a, t))
forall(a b t). is_clutched_in(a, b, t) -> hold(b, a, t)
forall(a b t). kneel_beside(a, b, t) -> enter(a, room, t)
forall(a b t). examine(a, b, t) -> enter(a, room, t)
forall(a b t). is_victim_of(a, b, t) -> not(is_onto(a, b, t))
formula:
Scope:
ForAll([a, t],
       Implies(enter(a, room, t), Not(enter(a, floor, t))))
ForAll([a, b, t],
       Implies(lie_on(a, b, t), Not(is_scattered(a, t))))
ForAll([a, b, t],
       Implies(hold(a, b, t), Not(is_scattered(b, t))))
ForAll([a, b, t],
       Implies(hold(a, b, t), Not(lie_on(b, a, t))))
ForAll([a, b, t],
       Implies(is_clutched_in(a, b, t), hold(b, a, t)))
ForAll([a, b, t],
       Implies(kneel_beside(a, b, t), enter(a, room, t)))
ForAll([a, b, t],
       Implies(examine(a, b, t), enter(a, room, t)))
ForAll([a, b, t],
       Implies(is_victim_of(a, b, t), Not(is_onto(a, b, t))))
enter(sam_carter, room, T1)
is_lit(room, room, T1)
is_a_mess(room, T1)
is_scattered(papers, T1)
is_overturned(furniture, T1)
is_victim_of(victim, journalist, T1)
lie_on(body, floor, T1)
hold(victim, pen, T1)
is_clutched_in(pen, hand, T1)
kneel_beside(sam_carter, body, T2)
examine(sam_carter, scene, T2)
is_onto(victim, something, T1)
stick_out_from_under(piece_of_paper, desk, T2)
T1 > T0
T2 > T1

full_conversation:
Detective Sam Carter entered the dimly lit room. "What a mess!", he muttered, surveying the scattered papers and overturned furniture. The victim, a local journalist, lay sprawled on the floor, a pen still clutched in his hand.
(User: Sam knelt beside the body, examining the scene. "Looks like he was onto something big. But what?" He noticed a torn piece of paper sticking out from under the desk.)
full_formulas:
{'global': [ForAll([a, t],
       Implies(enter(a, room, t), Not(enter(a, floor, t)))), ForAll([a, b, t],
       Implies(lie_on(a, b, t), Not(is_scattered(a, t)))), ForAll([a, b, t],
       Implies(hold(a, b, t), Not(is_scattered(b, t)))), ForAll([a, b, t],
       Implies(hold(a, b, t), Not(lie_on(b, a, t)))), ForAll([a, b, t],
       Implies(is_clutched_in(a, b, t), hold(b, a, t))), ForAll([a, b, t],
       Implies(kneel_beside(a, b, t), enter(a, room, t))), ForAll([a, b, t],
       Implies(examine(a, b, t), enter(a, room, t))), ForAll([a, b, t],
       Implies(is_victim_of(a, b, t), Not(is_onto(a, b, t)))), enter(sam_carter, room, T1), is_lit(room, room, T1), is_a_mess(room, T1), is_scattered(papers, T1), is_overturned(furniture, T1), is_victim_of(victim, journalist, T1), lie_on(body, floor, T1), hold(victim, pen, T1), is_clutched_in(pen, hand, T1), kneel_beside(sam_carter, body, T2), examine(sam_carter, scene, T2), is_onto(victim, something, T1), stick_out_from_under(piece_of_paper, desk, T2), T1 > T0, T2 > T1]}

is_a_mess(a, t): object [a] is a mess for time [t]

full_timeline:
T0: The time before Detective Sam Carter entered the room.
T1: The moment when Detective Sam Carter entered the dimly lit room.
T2: The time when Sam knelt beside the body and examined the scene.
